greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 2*x, where constant x (A109169) satisfies the condition that the continued fraction expansion of 2*x (A109170) is equal to the continued fraction expansion of x (A109168) interleaved with positive even numbers.
example: The continued fraction expansion of x = A109168:
the continued fraction expansion of 2*x = A109170:
which equals the continued fraction of x interleaved with even numbers.
xref: Cf. A109168 (continued fraction of x), A109169 (digits of x), A109170 (continued fraction of 2*x).
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 21 2005
